intro: Houstonia rosea, commonly known as the rose pink bluemink, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, pinkish-purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded woodlands and is often found in sandy or loamy soils. Houstonia rosea has small, narrow leaves and produces clusters of small, showy blossoms in the spring. It is a perennial herb that plays a role in supporting local pollinators and maintaining ecological balance in its habitat.
